events.name: It's Not Rocket Science! - How to get into the Space Business
events.description:
Space technology is already all around us. Farmers use it to grow their crops, scientists use it to understand our environment, and medical researchers use it to learn more about human physiology and psychology.
Today, we live in a world where access to space is getting very cheap, due to miniaturisation of powerful technology and more efficient launch providers. There’s no reason why a couple of minimally funded entrepreneurs in a garage can’t become the world’s next billion dollar space company.
MoonshotX is excited to visit Singapore as a part of our 2017 international roadshow! Come along to our Q&A night at LEVEL3 to speak with our founder, Troy McCann, about the opportunities of the New Space sector for entrepreneurs and academic researchers. Get a better understanding of the Gemini program, discuss your application, and find out what you can expect as a successful applicant!
Gemini is designed to be a very early stage international incubator, with a strong focus on the individual's development rather than accelerating a specific startup business. Local events are conducted in key cities, and collaborative activities orchestrated through online services between program zones around the globe. There is a strong emphasis on the formation of peer support on local, regional and international scales. We take no equity.
In October 2017 we are planning to run our second Gemini cohort in 15 cities across Australia, Singapore, New Zealand, Canada and the US.
If you have ever had a massive idea that you think could change the world, then do not miss this event!
One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight, for a very long time, of the shore. - André Gide
events.location: LEVEL3, #03-22/24, 20 Pasir Panjang Rd, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117439

events.name: Engineering the Innovation Economy with HOPE Technik
events.description:
Meet Singapore's engineering commandos - HOPE Technik. Probably Singapore's most underrated company building some of the coolest technology around here, HOPE Technik works on projects ranging from first responder vehicles to drones to automated guided vehicles that automate traditionally labour-intensive materials movement process.
We'll have three leaders from HOPE Technik share about the cutting-edge projects they're working on, and how they're building a strong engineering culture.

Schedule:
6:30 - 7:00 PM: Registration
7:00 - 7:45 PM: Talks
7:45 - 8:15 PM: Panel / Q&A
8:15 - 9:00 PM: Networking

Speakers: 
- Jeff Tang, Chief Technology Officer, HOPE Technik
- Paul Wu, Chief Engineer, HOPE Technik
- David Lee, Software Engineer, HOPE Technik

Moderator: 
Sayanee Basu, Engineer, Singapore Power
events.location: NTUC Centre, One Marina Boulevard Level 8 Room 801, Singapore 018989
